H0.text: The Greek city Lacedaemon, (hence 'laconic' = minimal yet efficient language), also produced a word for frugality, from its more common name of what. Corinth

H1.text: The Greek city Lacedaemon, (hence 'laconic' = minimal yet efficient language), also produced a word for frugality, from its more common name of what. Thebes

H2.text: The Greek city Lacedaemon, (hence 'laconic' = minimal yet efficient language), also produced a word for frugality, from its more common name of what. Argos

H3.text: The Greek city Lacedaemon, (hence 'laconic' = minimal yet efficient language), also produced a word for frugality, from its more common name of what. SPARTA

A4.text: Sparta refers primarily to the main cluster of settlements in the valley of the Eurotas River.

A5.text: In antiquity, the state was known as Lacedaemon, while 'Sparta' referred to its capital, a group of villages in the valley of the Evrotas River in Laconia, in southeastern Peloponnese.
